text:

author: DerikHallin
text:
Because it almost certainly was. I mean, "us homos" and "us gays" are enough of a giveaway. But for completeness, a quick scan of this asshole's post history reveals:

Within the past few weeks, he's claimed to be a college student (both currently and 10 years ago), ex-lawyer, game developer, teenager, multimillionaire, father and married 7 years to a woman of the "opposite sex". He's also labeled himself a conservative, liberal, progressive, and centrist all in this period. And let's not gloss over referring to both himself and his friends as "colored people" (?!). The only thing he's been consistent about is being Korean, and given all the other bullshit, I'm not sure we can even believe that much.

Dude is sketchy as hell, almost certainly full of bullshit and has some issues to work out.

author: Hail_To_Hoots
text:
Bi & gender confused here: I 100% disagree. We should be fighting for our rights. It's completely fair to get mad at people not respecting your rights. If someone openly fights trans rights then I don't want to support that person. It's as simple as that.

It's not just someone with "opposing views", it's someone who is actively against our very existence. I don't want to roll over and have transphobia and homophobia become the norm. It's not being fragile, it's giving a fuck about those who are suffering from transphobia every single day.
